title: Minimal annotation sample
description: Multidimensional Quality Metrics (MQM) Core Error Typology for translation quality assessment

categories.name: Terminology
categories.description: Errors arising when a term does not conform to normative subject field or organizational terminology standards or when a term in the target content is not the correct, normative equivalent of the corresponding term in the source content.

categories.name: Accuracy
categories.description: Errors occurring when the target content does not accurately correspond to the propositional content of the source text because of distortion, omission, or addition to the message.

subcategories.name: Mistranslation
subcategories.description: Error occurring when the target content that does not accurately represent the source content.

subcategories.name: Mistranslation of technical relationship
subcategories.description: Target content inaccurate with respect to technical knowledge (even if the translation otherwise appears plausible).

subcategories.name: Ambiguous target content
subcategories.description: Target content that introduces an ambiguity that is not present in the source content.

subcategories.name: Overtranslation
subcategories.description: Error occurring in the target content that is inappropriately more specific than the source content.
